case_title: ANWAR SAIFULLAH KHAN vs Haji MUHAMMAD KABIR KHAN

accussed_details.name: Haji Muhammad Kabir Khan
allegation: Failure to comply with election laws

complaint_summary: The petitioner alleged corrupt and illegal practices by the respondent and failure of election authorities to comply with election laws, resulting in disenfranchisement of voters and irregularities in polling stations.
investigation_summary: The petitioner presented evidence including witness testimonies, official documents, and affidavits to substantiate claims of irregularities at polling stations, including absence of polling staff and disenfranchisement of voters.
judgment_summary: The court found that the absence of polling staff at Polling Station No. 101 and late commencement of polling at Polling Station No. 102 materially affected the election results. The election was declared void under Section 70(a) of the Representation of the People Act, 1976.
punishment: Election declared void; fresh elections ordered for Constituency NA-20 Lakki Marwat, Bannu.
legal_arguments: Violation of Section 9(1) and Section 26 of the Representation of the People Act, 1976.
Failure to comply with Article 218(3) of the Constitution.
Material impact on election results due to disenfranchisement of voters.
witnesses: 138 witnesses including 105 female witnesses examined by Civil Judge Lakki Marwat

witness_statement.Mir Abbas: Confirmed absence of polling staff at Polling Station No. 101.
witness_statement.Mehrun Nisa: Testified late commencement of polling at Polling Station No. 102.
witness_statement.Mashal Khan: Alleged polling resumed after official close at Polling Station No. 55.
witness_statement.Gul Akbar Khan: Confirmed disenfranchisement of 671 female voters at Polling Station No. 101.

maxims.Burden of Proof: Petitioner must prove allegations beyond reasonable doubt.

legal_terms.Disenfranchisement: Deprivation of the right to vote.
legal_terms.Election Tribunal: A judicial body that resolves disputes related to elections.

words_and_phrases.Polling Station: Designated location for voters to cast their votes.
words_and_phrases.Returning Officer: Official responsible for overseeing the election process in a constituency.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved allegations of corrupt practices and irregularities during the 1997 election for Constituency NA-20 Lakki Marwat, Bannu. Key issues included disenfranchisement of voters due to absence of polling staff and late commencement of polling. The court declared the election void, citing material impact on results and non-compliance with election laws.
